question: Who has become the first Japanese player to clinched the women's singles title of US Open 2018?
explanation: Naomi Osaka has become the first Japanese player to win a Grand Slam singles title. She lifted the women\'s singles title of US Open 2018 by defeating Serena Williams of US in straight sets 6-2, 6-4. The match saw some dramatic scenes at the Grand Slam final after an angry Serena Williams accused the umpire of being a \"thief\". Williams was given a game penalty for her outburst, which also followed racquet smashing and another code violation as Osaka kept her focus to become the first Japanese to win a Grand Slam.
